intro: Haplocarpha oocephala, commonly known as the narrow-headed grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is a small annual grass that typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. The plant has slender stems and narrow leaves, with small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, which is a common adaptation in grass species. Haplocarpha oocephala is native to regions of North America and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
